intro: Acronia cauda-phocae, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plumbaginaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage, which are adapted to coastal environments. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along shorelines, demonstrating a high tolerance for salt and wind. Its root system is specialized for anchoring in loose, unstable substrates. Acronia cauda-phocae plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
